intro: Jupunba floribunda, commonly known as the clustered jupunba, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure. Jupunba floribunda is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine by local communities.
